intro: Carex tasmanica, commonly known as Tasman flat sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Tasmania and southern Australia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its triangular stems and grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in wetland or swampy environments, preferring moist, well-drained soils. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikes, which are often clustered at the ends of the stems. Carex tasmanica plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
